story:
Tiny Size

At less than 11 liters of volume, !nverse is one of the smallest cases on the market. Every part of this case serves multiple purposes, making efficient use of space and allowing you to mix and match components to create your ideal PC.

Sleek, Modern Look

Let's face it, the case is the part of your computer that everyone sees, so it's important that it looks good. !nverse embraces the aesthetics of the technological age with curved lines and a simple elegant look.

Exhaust hole design is inspired by the binary operations that govern digital computation. There are also other types of code mixed in, can you tell which ones?

For a truly luxurious feel, the exterior is manufactured from aluminum, anodized and then bead-blasted to produce a matte finish that is second to none. The interior is manufactured from steel for maximum support.

Unbelievable Component Compatibility

!nverse is the only case of its size that has simultaneous support for all of the below:

Here are some sample builds you can make with !nverse.

Extreme Ease of Build

While !nverse is highly compact, its novel interior design allows builders to install components in more open space than a full-size tower. Components are separately installed onto the top and bottom frames, and then everything comes together at the end, just like a sandwich.

To give you an idea of what it's like to build a PC in !nverse, we have made a sample video of the build process.

Thermal Performance

!nverse is designed such that all air intake holes are on the bottom. With fans drawing cool air in, positive pressure then pushes hot air exhaust out from airholes on all 4 sides.

 

To test if !nverse can handle the highest performance components, we tested !nverse with a Gigabyte R9 390 (the hottest graphics card in recent years) and an i5-4690K CPU overclocked to 4.4 GHz (as far as it'll go).The CPU cooler was a Cooler Master Seidon 240M while the graphics card has 2 x Silverstone FW121 case fans over it.

The graphics card was stress-tested with Unigine Valley while the CPU was stress-tested with prime95. Under these conditions, the maximum GPU temperature is about 80 degrees Celcius while the maximum CPU temperature (4-core average) is about 83 degrees. These temperatures are only about 5-8 degrees higher than if the components were tested in open air (no case at all to interfere with airflow). !nverse is not only the smallest case design that can house these components, but also one of the best performing.

For the detailed thermal test, check out our test write-up!

Dust Protection

With every PC that's built to last, dust protection is an imperative. Excessive dust being inhaled into your computer can lead to heating inefficiency, preventing you from getting the best performance out of your PC. Furthermore, excessive dust build-up can lead to electric shorts on your motherboard, potentially ruining a PC that your spent lots of time and money on.

Every air intake area at the bottom of !nverse is surrounded by 4 screw holes, allowing the user to use any 120mm dust filter of their choosing. Take your pick between any magnetic or plastic dust filters; !nverse has you covered.

Accessories

Bundled with !nverse are the following accessories:

  1. A shielded PCIe extender cable from LiHeat, a reputable maker whose work we have tested extensively
  2. 2 support struts to take the place of the compartment divider if you choose to remove it
  3. 1 x 3.5" hard drive bracket for mounting an extra hard drive
  4. 1 x 2.5" hard drive bracket for mounting an extra hard drive
  5. 15mm tall case feet
  6. (Optional) Specially designed !nverse case stand

Discussions and News

Check out what others say about !nverse and don’t forget to share if you like the posts.

 

FAQ

Q: Where is the power button?

A: The power button is on the bottom of the case, near the front. With the provided 15mm case feet, you will have no problem reaching it.

Q: There are no exhaust holes on the top, only on the sides. Doesn't that go against "hot air rises"? How would that impact temperatures?

A: The effects of hot air rising are negligible compared to the forces produced by fans. Please check out this article for reference.​

Q: !nverse supports AIO radiators with 240mm radiators and FEP tubing. Does it support 2 independent AIO radiators with 120mm radiators and FEP tubing?

A: Possibly. I'll need to add 4 screw holes to the design, but it can theoretically work by having one radiator attached to the interior frame in the "fan first" configuration and the other radiator attached in the "radiator first" configuration. These 2 radiators will need to be attached side-by-side, and the tubing of the one in "fan first" configuration will need to make a pretty sharp turn, but it should fit. For this scenario, you'll need to remove the compartment divider.

Q: I want to put stuff onto the !nverse case, but I'm worried it'll break. Hold me.

A: Don't worry, I have put a 50" TV on top of the !nverse case, and it's definitely capable of handling more.

Q: Does !nverse support custom water-cooling solutions?

A: !nverse is not designed to support custom water-cooling. However, after having spoken with many liquid-cooling enthusiasts, we think that it may be possible with some light modding.

Q: Some prototypes pictures have 2 front USB ports while others have 1. Which is it?

A: The production model of !nverse will have 2 front USB 3.0 ports.

Q: How does !nverse do on noise?

A: We don't have the equipment to objectively test the noise spectrum of !nverse. However, by the "ear test", we don't think that !nverse is any different from other metal cases in terms of noise.

Q: Why did you drill all those holes on the prototype in the temperature test?

A: That was one of the earlier prototypes. We wanted to test many different airhole configurations to figure out the best balance of thermal efficiency and aesthetics. The resulting airhole configuration is what you see today.

Q: Does !nverse support internal optical drives?

A: !nverse does not support internal optical drives.

Q: Will you offer !nverse with more color choices?

A: We are working with our manufacturer to hopefully offer more colors.

For further details, check out our website!

 

Timeline

Risks & Challenges

As with all crowdfunded projects, unexpected situations could come up that may delay delivery of the product. In our case, since we have already made multiple functional prototypes, including one with our current manufacturer, we are fairly confident in our ability to deliver on time.

If problems do arise, we have taken necessary precautions to minimize their effect. The most likely potential source of issues is probably our manufacturer. To facilitate our communication with the manufacturer in China, we have stationed a team member within 15 minute driving distance from the factory. This will allow us to maintain tight communication with them and prevent any delays.

In the event of other unexpected issues, we promise to maintain a completely transparent communication with our backers, as well as try our hardest to work through problems as quickly and efficiently as possible.

Thermal Performance
!nverse is designed such that all air intake holes are on the bottom. With fans drawing cool air in, positive pressure then pushes hot air exhaust out from airholes on all 4 sides.
 

To test if !nverse can handle the highest performance components, we tested !nverse with a Gigabyte R9 390 (the hottest graphics card in recent years) and an i5-4690K CPU overclocked to 4.4 GHz (as far as it'll go).The CPU cooler was a Cooler Master Seidon 240M while the graphics card has 2 x Silverstone FW121 case fans over it.
The graphics card was stress-tested with Unigine Valley while the CPU was stress-tested with prime95. Under these conditions, the maximum GPU temperature is about 80 degrees Celcius while the maximum CPU temperature (4-core average) is about 83 degrees. These temperatures are only about 5-8 degrees higher than if the components were tested in open air (no case at all to interfere with airflow). !nverse is not only the smallest case design that can house these components, but also one of the best performing.
For the detailed thermal test, check out our test write-up!
Dust Protection
With every PC that's built to last, dust protection is an imperative. Excessive dust being inhaled into your computer can lead to heating inefficiency, preventing you from getting the best performance out of your PC. Furthermore, excessive dust build-up can lead to electric shorts on your motherboard, potentially ruining a PC that your spent lots of time and money on.
Every air intake area at the bottom of !nverse is surrounded by 4 screw holes, allowing the user to use any 120mm dust filter of their choosing. Take your pick between any magnetic or plastic dust filters; !nverse has you covered.
Accessories
Bundled with !nverse are the following accessories:

A shielded PCIe extender cable from LiHeat, a reputable maker whose work we have tested extensively
2 support struts to take the place of the compartment divider if you choose to remove it
1 x 3.5" hard drive bracket for mounting an extra hard drive
1 x 2.5" hard drive bracket for mounting an extra hard drive
15mm tall case feet
(Optional) Specially designed !nverse case stand



Discussions and News
Check out what others say about !nverse and don’t forget to share if you like the posts.

 
FAQ

Q: Where is the power button?
A: The power button is on the bottom of the case, near the front. With the provided 15mm case feet, you will have no problem reaching it.
Q: There are no exhaust holes on the top, only on the sides. Doesn't that go against "hot air rises"? How would that impact temperatures?
A: The effects of hot air rising are negligible compared to the forces produced by fans. Please check out this article for reference.​
Q: !nverse supports AIO radiators with 240mm radiators and FEP tubing. Does it support 2 independent AIO radiators with 120mm radiators and FEP tubing?
A: Possibly. I'll need to add 4 screw holes to the design, but it can theoretically work by having one radiator attached to the interior frame in the "fan first" configuration and the other radiator attached in the "radiator first" configuration. These 2 radiators will need to be attached side-by-side, and the tubing of the one in "fan first" configuration will need to make a pretty sharp turn, but it should fit. For this scenario, you'll need to remove the compartment divider.
Q: I want to put stuff onto the !nverse case, but I'm worried it'll break. Hold me.
A: Don't worry, I have put a 50" TV on top of the !nverse case, and it's definitely capable of handling more.
Q: Does !nverse support custom water-cooling solutions?
A: !nverse is not designed to support custom water-cooling. However, after having spoken with many liquid-cooling enthusiasts, we think that it may be possible with some light modding.
Q: Some prototypes pictures have 2 front USB ports while others have 1. Which is it?
A: The production model of !nverse will have 2 front USB 3.0 ports.
Q: How does !nverse do on noise?
A: We don't have the equipment to objectively test the noise spectrum of !nverse. However, by the "ear test", we don't think that !nverse is any different from other metal cases in terms of noise.
Q: Why did you drill all those holes on the prototype in the temperature test?
A: That was one of the earlier prototypes. We wanted to test many different airhole configurations to figure out the best balance of thermal efficiency and aesthetics. The resulting airhole configuration is what you see today.
Q: Does !nverse support internal optical drives?
A: !nverse does not support internal optical drives.
Q: Will you offer !nverse with more color choices?
A: We are working with our manufacturer to hopefully offer more colors.

For further details, check out our website!
 
Timeline
Risks & ChallengesAs with all crowdfunded projects, unexpected situations could come up that may delay delivery of the product. In our case, since we have already made multiple functional prototypes, including one with our current manufacturer, we are fairly confident in our ability to deliver on time.If problems do arise, we have taken necessary precautions to minimize their effect. The most likely potential source of issues is probably our manufacturer. To facilitate our communication with the manufacturer in China, we have stationed a team member within 15 minute driving distance from the factory. This will allow us to maintain tight communication with them and prevent any delays.In the event of other unexpected issues, we promise to maintain a completely transparent communication with our backers, as well as try our hardest to work through problems as quickly and efficiently as possible.

story:
Wearable technology has forever changed how we interact with information.

At first it seems like a trivial advantage, but after a while, you realize that not having to get your phone out to stay in touch is a huge plus.  Simply twisting your wrist and tapping your watch has made it easier than ever to get that bit of information you need. 

Custom Apple Watch apps give you the info you need on your wrist, but takes a lot of work!

Trouble is, sometimes that piece for information you want isn't available on Apple Watch and you can't find an app to get it. Too bad there isn't an Apple Watch app that has the flexibility to help you get any piece of online information onto your wrist....well now, there is!


Wrist-View

Wrist-View solves the problem of how to get information that lives on the Web onto your wrist. It's a flexible content viewer for Apple Watch is a single, central app to view the information you need quickly and easily without having to jump between apps.

Instead of having to check who knows how many different websites or apps, you can keep up to date with Wrist-View.  It combines all the different sources of information that you're interested in one simple app.  With a twist of your wrist you can get up to date in seconds, instead of going from site to site to see what's new.

Not only can you view content, but it's "interactive content". Meaning that links on UI elements can take you to another page, kind of like a web browser, but 100% Native Apple Watch. This allows content to be extremely interactive and seem like an app, but without any coding or hassles.

Wrist-View "Channels" translates content on the Web to a format that Apple Watch can display natively.  We've got Channels running right now, and we're making more every day.

Wrist View is able to show you the information you want, with the same quality of a custom developed Apple Watch App, but with no coding!


Once Wrist-View goes live, you will be able to setup a profile to indicate what kind of content you're interested in, such as News, Technology, Finance, Entertainment, Sports, etc. Based on this information, you'll see Channels that are likely to have content you're interested in.

Wrist-View will be able to pull information from any standard RSS feed to give you instant ways to access the information you want to have handy.  But that is just the beginning.  Wrist-View uses the contents of RSS feeds as one source of information for our Channels, but adds considerably functionality on top, it's not just a standard RSS Reader.

When the content changes for these  Channels it will automatically be displayed on your Watch Face and downloaded to your watch in the background.  When you go to view the content, you'll be able to see it immediately, since it's stored locally.  You'll even be able to read cached content even if you're not within range of your iPhone!

There are currently Channels for top News and Entertainment delivered instantly to your Apple Watch in one central location.

You'll see Channels with content that blurs the line between 'Content' and 'App'.  This content will be interactive, allow you to input data such as the bill total for a Tip Calculator, etc.  This will make it easier than ever to have everything you need, right on your wrist.As Channels become available, you'll be notified if they match your interests. We've got over 60 Channels right now to give you all types of information from News, Finance, Weather, and much more.  With your help, there will be something for everyone very soon!

Native Features

In addition to 100% Native UI components, Wrist-View also uses other Apple Watch functionality, such as Complications, GPS Location, iBeacons, Handoff, Dynamic Type, Haptic Taps, Background Content Updates, Silent Push Notifications, etc.  These Native Features will be easy to take advantage of and will greatly enhance the experience of using Wrist-View.  

Complications

Despite the name, Watch Face Complications makes it extraordinarily easy to stay informed.  Using our Channel Server, Wrist-View receives updates based on a schedule you setup.  When something new comes in, it is sent to your Watch in the background and updates the Complication Timeline.  You can even configure it to give you a Haptic Tap when new info is available.  By tapping the Complication, you can go directly to the content details quickly and easily.

This means that no matter what channels you've subscribed to, be it in an RSS feed, Web Content, your own custom channel, etc., when new content is available it will automatically show up on your Watch Face.  No more checking multiple websites and multiple apps to stay up to date.  Wrist View keeps you informed with virtually no effort on your part.

Wrist-View also make the most efficient use of Complications.  Since Wrist-View collects content from many different sources (movies, news, stocks, etc.) it can use the same Complication to display many different types of information.  Other Apple Watch apps only show one type of information on a Complication.  

Time Travel and Complications allow you to see what new information is available, and takes you to that content with a single tap.


Handoff

Handoff is one of the cooler features that allows you to start viewing content on Apple Watch and continue viewing it on another compatible Apple Device.  This means that if you see something interesting on your watch with Wrist-View, you can simply walk over to your Mac and bring up the same page with a single click.

This makes Wrist-View is a great way to view content even if you're sitting at your desk.  If you're doing some work, and you see some interesting content on your watch, you can view the first couple paragraphs on your watch and see if you're interested in it.  If so, just click on the Safari handoff icon in your dock, and you can be viewing the entire web page in just one click.  Nothing is easier or quicker than that!


Handoff allows you to start viewing content on Wrist-View and simply click a link on your desktop to continue viewing it there.


Dynamic Type

Apple Watch is a cool wearable device with a high resolution Retina screen. Trouble is, there is no one size fits all solution when it comes to things like the size of text to display.  Luckily, Apple Watch has this covered and Wrist-View makes it easy to use.

Wrist-View supports Adaptive type in content. This allows users to select the size of text that is best for them.


Dynamic Type allows each user to select the size of text that is perfect for their viewing preference.  Wrist-View was designed to respond to this preference so that text content is perfect for each and every user.  If you're using Wrist-View to view content, you'll be able to view text how it suits you best.

Location Aware

Wrist-View will be able to use your GPS Location (if you allow it) and iBeacon Technology (if you allow it) to detect and alert you to content that is relevant to your current position.  This will let you get information about a commuter train delay when you pull into the station parking lot, lunch specials at a nearby cafe, or a discount at a coffee shop 2 blocks away.

There will be Channels to alert you of accidents nearby while you're driving, speed traps, red-light cams, and other Points of Interest.  We'll be able to bring new functionality to life just by creating a new Channel, which can be done in a day or two, not weeks or months to build an app from scratch.

Let Wrist-View find interesting content for you, based on your current location


If you choose to turn off location alerts, you can still find out about local content when you want to.  When Wrist-View detects local content, it will store it, but not alert you if you have alerts turned off.  When you're ready, you can check local content that has been detected, so it's the best of both worlds.  You can still find out about local deals and POI's, but totally on your terms.  If you choose to, you can also have this information display on your Watch Face via Complications for the ultimate in ease of staying informed.

When you find something you like, you can save it for easy access later or share with your friends.  Staying informed and up to date has never been easier!

Harness the power of iBeacons!

iBeacons is a great technology which allows you to detect Content indoors.  Wrist-View will be able to recognize iBeacons and alert users with a customized message.  This will help you find deals when you walk into a store, or find out about 'Coming Soon' attractions when you walk into a movie theatre.

If you own or manage a store or restaurant, Wrist-View is a great way to start using iBeacon technology quickly and affordably.  You'll be able to get deals and info into the hands of customers who walk into your store.  

With one iBeacon and a Channel for your establishment, you'll be able to connect with customers as they walk through your door.  You can offer them a deal when they walk in and say "Thanks for coming" when they leave.


Wrist-View helps you use iBeacon technology to interact with your customers in new ways.

Background Updates

Another neat feature of Wrist-View is Background Updates. This allows information to be transferred to your watch before you need it. When you go to view the information, it will be there with no delay in loading it.

Wrist-View can receive Background Updates while you're using another app, while you're just checking the time, etc.  When you go to view some content that was transferred in the background, it will show instantly, and allows you to get access to the information you need even more quickly.

This is a great way to keep content that you view often, such as News, Weather, Stock Quotes, etc. up to date all the time.  You can select what Channels are transferred in the background and when so you always have current info.

Channel yourself

One of the Stretch Goals of this project is to create a Web Based 'Channel Editor' that will allow you to map content from web-pages to Apple Watch and create your own Channels. This will let you get the exact content you want onto your wrist quickly and easily even if there isn't a pre-existing Channel for what you want.

Wrist-View Channels help transform traditional web content into a format you can easily view on your wrist.

The Channels you create can be marked as Private, so only you can see it. You can also make your Channels Public, so the world can discover and enjoy what you have created.

We already have the core functionality for Channels running in Node.js right now. The missing link is to put a self-service UI to configure that service. Even if you don't want to create your own Channels, there will always be tons of content ready to go with just a tap of your watch.

IoT - Watch Out!

This is a great way to hook up to IoT devices, such as a Raspberry Pi, your Nest Thermostat or maybe a private server. You can also integrate Wrist-View into IFTTT Channels for even more capabilities. Anything that speaks HTTP can be integrated with Wrist-View.

Wrist-View makes it very easy to add Apple Watch integration into your existing Smart Home system, as long as there is an HTTP based API to call. This makes it easier to re-use what you already have instead of starting over with a brand new system.

Stretch Goals


If we hit US$35,000 we'll be including some really cool integrations into Slack, the fastest growing collaboration tool used by millions.  This will let you keep tabs on your favorite content, right inside the collaboration tool you might already be using.  There will be a custom slash command to make it all possible.

If we hit US$50,000 we'll be including a version of the Channel Server on the iPhone app.  This means that you'll be able to setup Private Apple Watch Channels on your iPhone locally.  If you want to setup channels that need login credentials, you can rest easy knowing that any information you enter will only be stored only on your iPhone.  There will also be an SSH module included so that you can securely login with SSH credentials.  This will allow you to access servers, execute commands, and see the results all on your Apple Watch.  How cool will that be!

If we hit US$75,000 then we'll create a Web UI for our Channel Editor so that you can create Channels on your own.  We create our Channels using a Node.js server to adapt a Web Page to the Apple Watch screens.  By providing a Web UI, anyone will be able to make their own Channels.



Where we're at

As you can see from the videos and screenshots, we've made a great deal of progress in bringing Wrist-View to life.  Spending countless hours proving out the concepts we wanted to include, will help ensure we have a successful project.  All the screenshots and videos on the project page came from the Alpha version of the Apple Watch app.  Nothing was Photoshop'ed or mocked up, this is all the real deal.

We've also submitted the current version of Wrist-View to the App Store and it's been approved!  It's on developer hold so we can add some more features, so it's not visible in the store right now.  Getting the app approved is a huge plus since it significantly reduces the risk of getting the app into the App Store later when the final version is ready.

We have been able to successfully Channel the content of web-sites onto Wrist-View as well and ensure the Complications are showing updates as they should.  We'll be creating many more Channels to ensure that a wide variety of content is available.

What we need now is your support so we can complete the Apple Watch App, setup more Channels of content and bring the world a great new way to stay up to date and in touch.  Select your perk now, and let's make this happen!

story:
Interior technical work consists of the GOgeneric system which in is installed in the strong, closed and non-assembled module. This technical work gives to PowerGO ONE reliable protection, the guaranteed work and efficiency, even after falling from height of the multi-story building or casual penetration of salty sea water.The closed back case PowerGO ONE is made of qualitative, nonallergic, dielectric material that allows to use it absolutely safely. Even if the device will appear incidentally in hands of your child, PowerGO ONE won't do him any harm.​

How to get it!

Become a backer of this project and Pick a Reward. You will be pre-ordering the PowerGO ONE. You'll get a special backer discount!  Want to buy more than one? Check out Rewards. 

 

 

In your life there are situations when you need to make an important call, to send an email or to share with friend’s impressions about the travel. Our smartphones lose the energy very quickly and very often we can't load it due to the lack of electricity. Modern portative accumulators have limited quantity of charges of your device that limits you in the opportunities. PowerGO creates energy itself for charging of our device. It isn't necessary to load and waste your time for recharge of energy store. The innovative system of generation of electricity which has equipped PowerGO ONE has allowed to make it the most compact and easy that you could always take it in any place.

 

We consider that PowerGO ONE has enough advantages that it has replaced ordinary chargers from our life.

            

Our team has developed compact and powerful system of generation of electricity is GOgeneric

This system has allowed to from a big antitype create the small and compact device capable to charge your devices or just to be a source for desk, hiking lamps, portative players or navigators

An internal part of PowerGO ONE is built in in the special protective module that will ensure stable functioning even in the conditions of an extreme travel

The system is capable to produce steadily and continuously electricity and to give to the device the following engineering factors:

  

The principle of operation is based on generating electricity by using a generator of the double rotation. This system developed by our team and is unique in the world.

Energy of PowerGO ONE allows to supply with energy practically all mobile and many household devices:

 

For turning on the device it is enough to scroll the lower part of PowerGO ONE on one turn.

One activation of PowerGO ONE is enough to charge your smartphone for 2 hours continuously

 

DELIVERY

 FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE

 

The business plan and model of working time schedule of the PowerGO organization it is worked out to trifles that gives you full confidence and a guarantee that your PowerGO ONE will come to you precisely in time

WARRANTY  

To achieve the objectives we make all efforts and we hope for your help. We warranty the GOgeneric system for five years, so and on PowerGO ONE because we are sure of it reliability, and also we are sure that PowerGO ONE will make your life brighter, freer and more interesting

 

Our progress is very fast because we work on their inventions every day, 24 hours a day!              

We want that PowerGO ONE became the mass device and that each person could always stay in touch where it wouldn't be. We want to start PowerGO ONE in mass production and we hope that such unique device as PowerGO ONE won't remain without your attention

Money is necessary for us to start of mass production of PowerGO ONE for:

- purchases of materials for production of PowerGO ONE cases

- purchases of materials for mass production of GOgeneric modules

- purchases of materials and the small tool for production of a large number of packings of PowerGO ONE

If you like PowerGO ONE tell about us to the friends

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Q: What is PowerGO ONE?

-PowerGO ONE is the first portable charger for your smartphone.PowerGO ONE is the first powerbank which doesn't need to be charged because it creates electric energy itself.

Q: How PowerGO ONE works?

-For turning on the device it is enough to scroll the lower part of PowerGO on one turn. One activation of PowerGO ONE is enough to charge your smartphone for 2 hours continuously.Energy of PowerGO ONE allows to supply with energy practically all mobile and many household devices.

Q: What am i getting when i purchase PowerGO ONE?

-You get a modern and stylish gadget which can charge your smartphone anywhere.

Q: Is this product an anti shock proof?

-The guaranteed work and efficiency, even after falling from height of the multi-story building.

Q: When my device will be delivered?

-October 2017.

Q: What guarantees?

-We give a guarantee for five years. You can return the product if you don't like.

Q: How much is shipping?

-Shipping is absolutely free worldwide.

Q: Do you offer a referral system for this campaign?

-Yes, we do. First, get at least one PowerGO ONE on our Indiegogo campaign. Then, get 5 friends to contribute to our campaign too, and you will be refunded on one PowerGO ONE! Here's how:

1. Log into Indiegogo (NOTE: you must be logged in!) and go to the PowerGO ONE campaign page.

2. Click the Twitter or Facebook icons to share the campaign via social media OR, click the “link” icon to copy your own personal link to share by email, messages or any other private communication with your friends.

3. Your link is personal and can be traced back to YOU. When someone clicks through to the page via your link and contributes to the campaign, Indiegogo’s system will automatically credit you as the referrer.

4. If five of your friends have contributed to the campaign through your link, you will get your total pledge amount for one (1) PowerGO ONE (including any shipping costs) back from us.

 

We will be always glad to answer your questions

Faithfully yours team GO Tech

story:
Who are we?

SY Technologies is a small home based technology start-up based in Port Elizabeth, South Africa. I am Sinethemba Yamani and I founded the company in 10th Grade at High School 2009. Our mission is to research, design and develop innovative technological solutions. Our vision is to become Africa’s leading technological innovator. In recent years we’ve been sharing some of our inventions with our growing audience on Facebook. This initiative has helped us to understand more about product development. To see more of what we have done please visit our Facebook page SY Technologies.

Who has talked about us?

The Port Elizabeth, South African local newsapaper - The Herald, 08 Feb 2017

Product Applications

For the duration of the campaign we will be uploading videos of product application, where we will be testing and demostrating typical applications of the InstruMod. You can comment on the comments section for any questions or suggestions.

Application update #1 : Measuring Rotational Speed (rev/s)

In this update we've tested and demonstrated the InstruMod's ability to be used as a Tachometer for measuring rotational speeds of DC Motors. In this update we also demonstrate that the InstruMod can be used as a power supplier that meets all the project needs of a typical application. The developer only needs to focus on the core project features and not to worry about buying additional  energy supplies and measuring instruments.

Block diagram of the project setup

Video demostrating the InstruMod in action
 
Application update #2: Troubleshooting a Power Supply Unit
 
In this update we've tested and demonstrated the InstruMod's ability to be used as a Multimeter for measuring voltage and testing continuity. We tested the positive supply terminal of a Dual Rail DC Power Supply.
Project setup
 
Project Video
 
Application update #3: Distance Measure
In this update we've tested and demonstrated the InstruMod's ability to measure distance with the on-board distance sensor.
Project setup
 

Project Video

Application update #4: Weight Measure
In this update we've tested and demonstrated the InstruMod's ability to measure Weight with the on-board weight sensor.
Project setup
 

Project video

Application update #5: Laser Leveller

In this update we've tested and demonstrated the InstruMod's ability to measure Weight with the on-board weight sensor.

Project setup

Project video

 

The Problem We're trying to solve

Having worked with the Formula Student Racing team at the Nelson Mandela Metropolitan University (NMMU) as Project lead in the Electric Vehicle, we often witnessed a daily problem of having a shortage of basic measuring tools. We were a large team but not enough basic measuring instruments for all the team members, so we had to take turns completing separate tasks. Problems like this always tend to slow production down to a crawl. Through research we’ve discovered that basic measuring tools are expensive and some students who build projects on a daily basis can’t afford to buy a reliable multi-meter, Vernier Caliper, not to mention a Power Supply, an Oscilloscope, a Function Generator and so many more. Though school laboratories are equipped with these expensive necessities they’re sometimes full, as everybody is busy working on a project. Labs aren’t open every day and are rarely opened during recess when everybody has free time.

How we intend on solving the problem

Introducing the InstruMod, a multi-functional smartphone based measuring instrument, some could rather refer to it as a pocket laboratory. The InstruMod is a Moto Mod, a modular measuring device that attaches onto a Moto Z smartphone and renders the smartphone capabilities of recording mechanical and electronics measurements. The design of the InstruMod focuses on factors such as affordability, convenience and reliability.

It’s that convenient pocket multi-meter, you’ve always wanted. You’ll be able to take measurements such as voltage, current, resistance, continuity and temperature using detachable probes. The design incorporates a wireless approach to eliminate the use of wires on probes.

No need for an external Oscilloscope or Function generator. We’ve identified that students often have to analyse electronics signals on an oscilloscope or regenerate them using a function generator, the InstruMod’s Android Application offers an on-board oscilloscope for analysing signals and an on-board function generator for generating signals.

The wireless probes are versatile in that they can be configured to operate in four modes to measure mechanical and electronics quantities. These modes are namely:

Mode 1 is Ruler mode: when both probes are joined end-to-end linearly they form a 30 cm long ruler which can be used for technical drawing.

 

Mode 2 is the Goniometer mode: The red probe consists of a rotatory potentiometer that is inserted into a slot on the end of the black probe. The red probe is then allowed to rotate with reference to the black probe, the resulting resistance is converted to an angle by an algorithm in the probe's microcontroller.

Mode 3 is the Vernier mode: This mode works by placing the two probes against each other, with a linear resistor in between, and sliding one probe against the other to create an increasing resistance that gets converted, with an algorithm in the probe's microcontroller, to distance.

Mode 4 is the Electronics mode: In this mode the probes are used to measure voltage, current, resistance, continuity and temperature. The probes are wireless, so to complete the circuit when taking electronics measurements, the probes will have to touch each other physically to complete an electrical connection. If measuring a large area, a long wire can be used to link up both probes.

The probes have their own microcontroller that is independent of the InstruMod’s microcontroller. This microcontroller on probes is responsible for converting the analogue data to digital data and sending that data wirelessly to the InstruMod for display and calculations. This also means that the probe’s software and hardware can be updated overtime to include more measuring features.

Other measurements are taken using the InstruMod’s on-board sensors, such as the:

  •  Weight sensor for measuring object weight,
  •  Light sensor used to determine the intensity of the light,
  •  IR sensor used as a tachometer to determine rotational speed
  •  and a distance sensor for measuring Length, Area and Volume.

 The InstruMod is equipped with a :

  •   Laser Leveller for keeping DIY projects in a straight accurate line.
  •   The Moto Z’s on-board Gyro and Accelerometer are used for determining inclination angle   and acceleration respectively.
  •  The on board 13MP Moto Z camera is used to document your project as it is being built.
  • Last but not least, the InstruMod can also be used as a 5v regulated power bank to supply development boards such as the Arduino, Raspberry pi and many more.

About the accompanying Android Application

The whole InstruMod package isn’t complete without the accompanying Android application. The accompanying Android application is designed to display readings, do calculations from the recorded values, logs the history of the project and consists of tutorials of how to use basic tools like a Vernier Caliper, Oscilloscope, multi-meter etc. The advantage of using the accompanying Android application is that you are able to build your projects specification sheet as you are busy prototyping your project. All your project documentation is done on the Android application which works seamlessly with the InstruMod for taking measurements. When the project is done you can just simply export your project documentation to a pdf file and if you’re working in a team you can just share all the projects specifics with your team members.

Basic working Android App to control the prototype via Bluetooth

What have we done so far?

To prove our concept, we’ve built a simple working prototype able to measure voltage, current, resistance and test continuity. The prototype also has an on-board IR sensor that’s used as a tachometer for measuring rotational speeds. We’ve also included an ultrasonic distance sensor, Laser leveler and a flash light.

We’ve used a STM32F4 Discovery board as our microcontroller but Prototype 2 will be developed on the Moto Mod Development Kit (MDK). The InstruMod is intended to work seamlessly with a Moto Z smartphone as a Moto Mod. When developing our first prototype we were just focused on proving the basic concept on a small scale, therefore the full product we’ll be developed with the MDK instead of the STM32F4 board and will connect seamlessly with the Moto Z through the Moto Mods interface connectors like all the other Moto Mods out there.

What We Need

We are a start-up and currently don’t have funds to further develop and mass produce the InstruMod.  In order for us to bring the InstruMod to the masses, we need to raise a minimum of $15 000 and this is how we're planning on spending it:

If we are unable to reach our target goal, we will not be able to further develop our project because of insufficient funds and the possibility of not being able to fulfill perks. We still have more inventions we would like to share with the World so please support our campaign and help us innovate the World through our imagination.

How to contribute

  •  You can pledge a contribution to our campaign by purchasing one of our unique perks which includes a pre-order of the InstruMod.
  •  If you just want to pledge because you really like this campaign and don't really want a perk, maybe because you don’t own a Moto Z smartphone, you can still  pledge any amount you’d like as a donation to our campaign. Just simply click the “Back it” button at the top of this page and make your contribution. All backers of the project will be given a shout out across all our social media platforms.

By being a contributor to our campaign, you are being part of a huge technological revolution taking place in South Africa and Africa at large where young innovators, such as us, are starting up small technology ventures that will hopefully grow in future to be one of the leading giants in this industry. Your involvement in this technology revolution is so priceless it cannot be measured by any perk.

Our timeline

 

The Impact

The InstruMod offers the versatility of being able to measure more than one quantity, the convenience of always having your measuring tool set in your pocket everywhere you go and the accompanying Android application helps in documenting your project details as you are building it. If you’re working as a team, the InstruMod will allow sharing of project specifics so that everyone in the team is made aware of everyone else’s work.

Risks & Challenges

This campaign is as a result of our entry into the ‘Transform the Smartphone Challenge’ by Indiegogo, Motorola, Lenovo and Verizon. After receiving the news that our concept had been chosen to participate in the competition we only had about a month to prepare for this Indiegogo campaign and build a working prototype model. Being short stuffed we could only accomplish so much in a very short space of time. The project is however developing and on its prototyping stage.

Before Launch we have already completed our first working prototype which just illustrates some of the features that the final product will have. Your contribution could help to speed up development and production by recruiting more Engineers. We are hosting the project on our webpage (sytechnologies5.wixsite.com/sytechnologies). This will allow you as the contributor to keep track of the project as it is being developed. This will also give you the rare opportunity of being involved in our product development, as you can leave suggestions on what is the best way we could approach this build and help us shape the project in the direction you feel will suite you best.

Because this is your product, we would love to hear your suggestions on our Facebook and webpage. We will encounter problems in future, be it delays in development or delays in manufacturing but we will regularly keep all our backers informed. Our goal is to deliver the InstruMod, a first of its kind, to the world. We will do all it takes to reach this goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are active on Facebook please visit our Facebook page SY Technologies, please like the page and share our story with friends and family. We host regular weekend projects that we think you might enjoy. You can also use the Indiegogo sharing tools to tell everyone about us. Your support in helping us promote our campaign will be crucial in reaching our funding goal. The best way to support us is by backing us up. By doing that, you are part of a new technological revolution taking place in South Africa and Africa at large. Thank you!

story:
Planning on buying the next iPhone don't worry! 

We are planning on it too, so if you do decide that you would like a Quip Case for the iPhone 8, we will simply contact you before we ship and ask you to specify what model you would like! 

 
Just 3 of the possible scenarios avoided with a Quip Case! 
Problem #1: Battery Life
- The Quip Case's battery is significantly larger than the battery in the standard case, since the Quip Case enables you to charge your phone along with AirPods it will be hard to run out of battery! 
 

Problem #2: Misplacing or Forgetting your AirPods

- The Quip Case stores your phone and AirPods together so you won't have to worry about misplacing your AirPods. As long as you have your iPhone on you you're good to go!

Problem #3: Cluttered Pockets 

- Consolidating the AirPods and iPhone into one place has the added benefit of no longer will you need to fumble through your pockets when you get a call you can simply pull them out of your phone! 

 

 

 

Story

I'm Callam Ingram, a 19-year old from Venice Beach, California, and founder of Quip Technologies, the maker of the Quip Case. 

I feel as if I was born to do this, my whole life entrepreneurship has seemed like my only option. When I was 12 years old, I started a skateboard business with two of my friends. We figured out which was the best wood to buy, learned how to make and sell skateboards, calculated how many we needed to sell to make a profit, and safeguarded our company money. We were successful. We sold a few boards, made a profit, and moved on. 

Where the idea first started, with a bad idea.

My first thought was that the battery life of the AirPods could be a problem. My dog and I go for long walks almost every night, and I listen to music or audiobooks for the majority of the time. I was worried that I would walk long enough to run out of battery. I thought the idea of wire optional Bluetooth headphones would be good, so you could plug them in when you needed to and when you wanted to go wireless you could. And, I thought, since you’re already carrying around your phone, it would be great if it could be an extra source of battery power. 

But then I did some sketches and realized that having wire-optional Bluetooth headphones was looking backward, and to build a company on technology that was quickly becoming obsolete was probably not the best idea. The problem was right, but the solution was wrong.

So the brainstorming continued

Since the AirPods had not yet been released yet, I had to try to imagine what it would be like to use them. After much thought, I realized the inconvenience of charging the AirPods was an issue worth solving. 

I then started to think that the problem may not be with the AirPods themselves, maybe the issue was the charging case. The more I thought about it, the more I realized I was onto something. 

While my wired headphones could be annoying, they took up very little space, and I often had them wrapped around my neck or dangling from my shirt. The idea of having to carry around an extra external charging case constantly seemed pretty inconvenient. 

This was my ‘aha’ moment.

I went to the art store that day, bought some clay and some foam board and began to prototype. I came out with a rough design with a focus on keeping the case as thin as possible.

I then enlisted the help of a designer to mock up some sketches. I quickly realized that I would need to do the designing myself - mostly because it wasn’t until I ‘got my hands dirty’ that I realized what I wanted to create.

I fell more and more in love with the idea the more I worked on it. It became my passion.

I started creating some mock-ups of the case in Fusion 360 (a C.A.D. software) Within a couple of days I had something that better reflected my vision.

It wasn't exactly beautiful but after continuous iterations, my C.A.D. skills improved and the designs got better and better. I was hopeful that I would learn enough to complete this project by myself. Pretty early on, the constant pressure began to get to me. I felt like I was breathing underwater and the only way to make the feeling subside was to working tirelessly toward my goal. I had (and still have) a burning feeling that, if I didn’t act now, I would miss my shot. The only way I felt better - calmer, was when I was working toward my goal. I decided I needed to move faster and that meant getting help from professionals. 

I began discussing the idea with successful entrepreneurs in my life, and they all advised me to get a patent. So after selling some of my Tesla stock to pay for the lawyer fees, I asked around and found a patent lawyer through one of my close friends. I worked on the application to reduce the cost. Soon I had a provisional patent. 

With the excitement of knowing that my idea was protected, I began to reach out to design firms, eventually finding ANDesign, a full-service design firm based out of Long Beach, California. 

Working closely with ANDesign to refine the concept, which went through many conceptual iterations, we got closer. My excitement, as well as fear, were simultaneously growing. As we progressed I realized that this wasn’t just an opportunity to make the first charging case that charges the AirPods and the iPhone; it was an opportunity to make the best charging case of all time. 

It was an opportunity to make the best charging case of all time.

So what does that entail? 

Well, it means that the best charging case of all time not only has to have the best functionality but it also needs to meet the basic requirements of charging your phone. We decided that to do this, we had to use USB-C - even though it is more expensive - because it enables fast charging. It was only after we came up with the idea that we realized that there are no other mainstream cases out there that take advantage of this technology. Once designs were completed, I got the files from ANDesign.

I began creating animations to showcase the product using KeyShot a photorealistic rendering software.  I designed the Quip Case because I wanted to make my life easier. And now I have the opportunity to make your life easier, too. 

This journey has produced more than an amazing product, it has led me to my passion, and with your help, it can be bigger than I ever dreamed. 

Thank you for your time and your support!

story:
Pitch

In this digital age, we have all come to raise our expectations when it comes to shopping. Amazon has spoiled us, to put it simply. We want to point and click; we want to be told what it is that we would like. Scouring the mall for that perfect item: that’s a thing of the past. Everything is put in front of us now, the process made quick, easy, and painless. There is already enough trouble, after all, navigating the crowds, worrying about your credit card, finding a place to park. If we want to make going to the mall fun again, we need to put it on the same playing field as online shopping.

With Bmosmart, that is exactly what we are using. A mobile app that uses beacon and Bluetooth technology, Bmosmart will send push messages to your phone that tell you information that is relevant to you, picking out the products you would love that are in the styles, sizes, and colors that are right for you. Bmosmart will also point you in the direction of the stores that carry what it is that you’re looking for, like a suggested item panel that sits inside your pocket.

We have come to you, (Via Indiegogo), for help raising $17500. This start-up capital is going to cover the costs of developing, launching, and marketing Bmosmart, bringing it to malls all around the world. Your contributions will make this technology available to the people who need it most. We appreciate every dollar. Thank you.


Short Summary

Are you tired of the challenges you face while to get things in a shopping mall?

Have you ever tried getting to a shopping mall, but unfortunately, it’s difficult to locate the products you need even though everything is congested, not to talk of the means of payments?

However, do you know a very simple and better option can make you easily get over all challenges in the shopping mall?

It is called the BMOSMART. Bmosmart is a Mobile app that uses beacon & Bluetooth technology. Beacon technology is ushering us into an era of completely customizable shopping. It is a new way of shopping, technically designed to erase any form of hustle in our shopping mall or other retail outlets.

Beacon technology makes use of beacon device that will be located in a retailer's store; it has low-powered energy signals.

Beacon uses BLE Bluetooth; it can push messages about the available products, styles, size images, colour from the retailer’s beacon device to your mobile phone whenever you are near the store.

Beacon also helps you locate a particular store as soon you enter a shopping mall with the use of indoor GPS mall maps to the navigator.

The Impact

Mobile proximity marketing

Depending on where the customers are in a store, and if they are As the customer moves to a different location, a new beacon carrying an enabled device, they will be able to receive messages in the area will alert them to offers on products they are now in from the closest beacon. For example, when browsing through a proximity to. Using mobile beacon technology, customers can specific section in a store, whether it be footwear or mp3 players, be contacted and kept informed while in-store to enrich their local beacon could share location-specific information on experience. Special offers, interesting facts, targeted promotions and more.

Low Cost

Low cost hardware and low-maintenance cost Hardware and maintenance cost is an important factor to implement any technology in business. 

Accurate Indoor location

When we talk about accurately entering customers’ indoor location (where GPS is Ineffective) is a problem that hardware manufacturers have been struggling with for years. 

Tracking & business intelligence

The most controversial but also the most common use case today spending inside the venue/location” and “where in a store/location of Wifi beacons is using the data collected by the Wifi hotspots for people spend most time”. This can be used for everything from business intelligence. 

Product/Service Description

The way we shop has changed dramatically over the last decade with the explosion of online retailers and daily deal websites: and now it is enjoying its latest revolution in the form of iBeacon technology.

Process

Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) Communication 
To understand how IBeacon works, it's important to first be familiar with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE). Bluetooth Low Energy is a network technology used to transmit data over short distances. BLE communication comprises of advertisements of small packets of data which are broadcast at regular intervals through radio waves. BLE broadcasting is a one-way communication method; it simply advertises its packets of data. These packets of data can then be picked up by smart devices nearby, which can be used for a number of applications to trigger events such as prompts, push notifications, and app actions.

Summary

When the market demand forecasts considered expected demand for Beacon Technology should be higher so expected Return on Investment. 

Beacon Technology is ready to take away all challenges you come across in a shopping mall or other retail outlets.

It has a very simple and secure process.

BMOSMART allows you to perform a cashless or swiping credit card transaction and renders a wonderful service through just the use of Bluetooth.

So what are you waiting for?

Beacon Technology is highly rated with outstanding customer’s reviews in the U.S and Europe. BMOSMART …. Smart shopping just began… Are you ready?

story:
Meet the Sticko Pad – A uniquely engineered pad that can stick everything to almost any smooth, flat & dry surfaces. Constructed specifically from a unique blend of rubber & plastic creating vacuum craters on the surface, allowing a super strong bond between any smooth surfaces without leaving any residue on the surface. The unique design let the Sticko Pad achieve best stick on both side with reusable and no-residue property. 

Stick on any Smooth Dry Surface

 

Sticko Pad can stick on almost any smooth, flat & dry surfaces including Metal, Plastic, Leather, Glass, Granite & Marbles, Wood and many more. No glue means no traces. Sticko Pad is fully charged. It can even stick to the ceiling!


One Pad, Unlimited Applications

  Visit 'Gallery' section for details of applications

Features




How it works

Using a thermoplastic elastomer imbued with our proprietary formula, we are able to create what can be best described as the 'Craters of Vacuum’. In its simplest terms, it is the power of millions of miniature vacuum craters, packed as tightly as the cells of your skin that it feels like a smooth plastic surface to your hand. The cumulative vacuum of these miniature craters generate strong enough bond to hold any contemporary mobiles and tablets to vertical surfaces.




Timeplan


How you can help?


About us

Sticko Pad is a little company based in India with the aim of improving life with innovative material solutions. We do so with the integrity and philosophy of always doing our best to deliver quickly, with an honest appreciation for our customers. We have a small team, but we give you big thanks for giving us the chance to create products for you.

We need your help to make this project happen! If you guys and gals bring us to our pledge goal, we promise to change the way you organize your possessions.

story:
'The Catch' Phone Case

  • Never Drop Or Lose Your Phone Again
  • Feel More Secure When Traveling
  • Hands-Free Convenience While Driving, Exercising or Walking

'The Catch' attaches your phone to your clothes, bag or belt in unique, uncompromising ways, which makes it more accessible for you! Protect your phone from accidental drops (in the toilet or on the ground!), theft and other random acts of chaos. 

We all know our phones are our lives! They carry our messages, photos, emails, important files, videos, games, books, to do lists, private thoughts, social lives and so much more.

Now you can protect it all like never before.

Take it on the go and free yourself from the worry of never seeing your life get lost. When traveling overseas or in crowded new areas, don't worry about being pick-pocketed ever again!

Features;

-Holds credit cards and keys all in one 

-Keeps your phone from dropping

-No more cracked screens/hardware damage

-Safer when traveling (can't be stolen when connected)

-Easier to get in your home at night (key attached)

-or Leave your purse at home! It holds 2 cards, keys and mace!

-Double Loop for car seat viewing

-Quad Case(4 loops) good for those with disabilities with difficulty holding a phone.

What's In It For you?

'The Catch' is not your ordinary phone case. It is a collection of phone cases for everyday use. 

To offer just one phone model case takes a large initial investment. To offer an entire line of options would take closer to 1 million. We are  testing the market here with these new options, and hope to raise $100,000 in order to guarantee up to 10,000 orders of the Catch Case, offered  in 2 phone models; The iPhone X and the Samsung Galaxy Note 9...as these are the top selling phones.

  • We have 3 unique designs, available in 2 phone models.  The more money we raise over this amount, means the more phone models we can offer, such as the IPhone 10R. Therefore, If we raise double the amount of money will offer these cases in 4 models, and so on. Staring with the most popular cell phone models. 
  • If we do not raise enough to cover the most basic costs of providing the molds for a minimum order($50,000) we will refund the money. Otherwise all the money will be used to develop and market the phone case line while gaining research into the market and discovering what people want.

The Impact

"I was just in Shenzen at the world cell phone convention, I saw everything...but I didn't see anything close to these designs"! -Bruce Brown, the Plastic Czar, Advanced Plastics.

The cell phone industry is obviously going to grow and grow bigger and bigger. The cell phone 'case market' has an incredibly big market potential, but currently with very few creative options available. I believe we are due for a revolution in user friendly phone case options and trends and I believe the Catch is at the cutting edge of all this potential. 

Risks & Challenges

We are testing the market with this new cell phone case line, to find out just how much interest there is. If we meet our goal there is no risk, but if we fall short, you will get your money back. We will still promote a powerful campaign based on the preferences we research, but there is no financial risk to you. 

The number of mobile phone users in the world is expected to pass the five billion mark by 2019. China is forecast to grow from around 563 million in 2016 to almost 675 million in 2019. Around half of the Chinese population is projected to use a smartphone by 2020. By 2019, the number of smartphone users in the U.S. is expected to increase to 247.5 million.  We are also interested in investors. Please consider investing in our campaign towards equity in the company. We have perks available in $20,000 increments. Currently we are valuing the company so that $20,000 buys 5%. Once the campaign is over we can re-valuate depending on how many molds we are able to manufacture.

Around half of the Chinese population is projected to use a smartphone by 2020. By 2019, the number of smartphone users in the U.S. is expected to increase to 247.5 million.  We are also interested in investors. Please consider investing in our campaign towards equity in the company. We have perks available in $20,000 increments. Currently we are valuing the company so that $20,000 buys 5%. Once the campaign is over we can re-valuate depending on how many molds we are able to manufacture.

story:
eNote Bluetooth Smart display platform

The eNote™ Wireless Display works like an electronic Post-it® note that can connect to any mobile or stationary gateway device.

eNote 'micro-signage' sends out your message visually and electronically. It combines an easy-to-read ePaper display with battery-thrifty Bluetooth® Smart wireless technology.


Join us

This is a campaign to bring additional developers to this platform and raise funds to bring the platform to production. You'll be the first to have access to the technology and all new features. We want you to join us and create amazing solutions that add to what we've done and go beyond what any one of us can imagine!

Imagine the Possibilities

A platform for your eyes and your smartphone, one that provides clarity for the message as well as a connection to rich information. We provide the platform and you can create unique solutions we can only dream of.

The eNote® platform combines the visual world with the electronic world to tag people, places and things. Beacons alone are really great, but they only provide information when you use another device like a phone: there is nothing for direct human interaction. 

The eNote display is designed for operation in office as well as light industrial environments. We're working on applications in a few areas, and we know that you will have even more:

  • Point-Of-Sale tags
  • Office: people, equipment and locations
  • Warehouse: equipment and stock tags
  • Notes for messaging in critical applications


Why we're crowdfunding

We want to build an ecosystem of applications using the eNote platform and need smart, creative developers to join us.  We have created the eNote product and its supporting software and shown several application areas, but we know that there are plenty of other great ideas that can utilize our technology.  By joining us, you'll get early access to the device and supporting software; you can help us influence features and capabilities of the end product; and you will have an opportunity to create your own businesses. 

  • You get the opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new ecosystem!
  • Your innovative and amazing applications will add to ours and drive high volumes and lower cost for the product.
  • Your funding will help pay for: tooling needed to produce cast parts, completing embedded software and iOS API, and regulatory approvals to make eNote a production product.

What you get


  • The Developer's Edition eNote product in cool clear plastic completely designed and produced here in the USA!
  • Source code for API for iOS (example app screens above)
  • Source code for iOS App supporting JPEG, QR code and text generation
  • Complete documentation
  • Additional unique perks including your name in the device and, of course, T-shirts

Product status

You can see the wealth of experience and expertise behind eNote in the Team Member link at the top of the Campaign. Our team members have long track records of delivering high quality products and projects. 

Our founder has brought breakthrough products and technology to life from HP calculators to Medtronic defibrillators, and has  been working with Bluetooth wireless technology since its inception.  He has helped dozens of companies with their products in the consumer, medical and industrial markets.  Now it is his turn, working with a fantastic group of experts in their fields!

The eNote platform is well on its way to being a real product.  We're already on our 3rd generation prototype, with tests including over 24,000 display write cycles on a single battery - simply phenomenal performance!  ePaper and Bluetooth Smart were made to go together.  There will be plenty of additional testing with your funding, but it is certainly on the path to being a robust and capable product.
What we have today:
  • Circuit design and PCB layout completed, prototypes built and working
  • Case design and prototype parts completed
  • RF tuning completed (and working great!)
  • Embedded firmware functional with some features still to be implemented.
  • Working iOS and iBeacon demo Apps
 We have several additional very exciting future features we'll accelerate if/when we exceed our funding goal.

eNote display Brief Specs
  • Bluetooth Smart (low energy) services: GAP/GATT, Battery, Device ID, eNote Display
  • ePaper display: 264x176 pixels, black/white
  • 3.25 x 2.0 x 0.38 inches, 1.6 oz
  • 0 - 50 degrees C
  • Sealed package with CR2450 620mAH battery, 3-5 years of normal operation (beacon + 2-3 writes/day)
  • To be qualified to: FCC, Bluetooth (testing and submission yet to be performed -  part of the campaign funding)
  • Note: the units supplied through the crowdfunding campaign may not have completed testing and certification by the time they are shipped.  These are development units.  Firmware upgrades will be provided as they are developed.

Product Risks & Challenges

We've done all we can to reduce risk on this project. We've prototyped, received quotations, and done design reviews with other engineers and production companies.

  • We're building these units on-shore in the US (as much as possible in Seattle) giving us direct connections with our suppliers.
  • We have a small team of very experienced and successful people.
That being said, there is always a chance that we won't be able to deliver on part or all of what we'd like. The current prototype units have not been fully tested to all of their specifications.  If the device is used differently from our models, specifications like battery life may come up short for particular applications.
This is a hardware project and small mistakes can cause rework with delays and disappointments.  Meeting FCC and Bluetooth qualification requirements may require changes and additional design and testing. 
The software is still evolving. 

Other ways you can help bring eNote to the world

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  email, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, voice, US Mail.  They're all good, and it will all help.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
IndieGogo will enable us to pursue the research and development necessary to optimize our technologies to produce an anti-germ temporary plastic screen protecting sticker that can be used to help deactivate viruses, bacteria, and other germs on the surface of the phone screen.  We have chosen to make an anti-viral sticker because it allows the user to discard the covering and replace it whenever they’d like to refresh the surface.

We believe we are uniquely qualified to offer consumers a safer way to prevent the accumulation of germs, viruses, and bacteria on one of the most frequently used devices in any given day:  the smartphone.  The screen is touched constantly to surf the web, dial numbers, is often pressed against the ears and lips, and is an easy means to transmit  every contaminant in our environment.

While complicated and expensive solutions do exist for cleaning smartphones, these solutions only remove accumulated germs and do nothing to prevent new germs from attaching.  We wanted to create a simple to apply and inexpensive means to kill germs on the phone screen.

We are a team of committed and passionate scientists holding PhDs in Chemistry, Materials Science and Engineering. 

Our founder, Frank Greer, developed our core technology of "nanotexturing", which enables an inexpensive and permanent way to alter the physical properties of glass and plastic surfaces such as tinting, antifog, and greater clarity. 

We hold multiple patents related to this manufacturing process and formed our company called "Nanoclear Technologies."  Our team was fortunate to receive significant venture capital backing which enables us to operate our dedicated laboratory where we can pursue our passions for creating new to world breakthrough innovations.

We have recently identified a method to use our core technology to produce an inexpensive manufacturable modification of plastic surfaces to create permanent anti-viral and anti-bacterial surfaces. As you are no doubt aware, during this COVID-19 pandemic, it has been established that due to the structure of this virus, it has the ability to live on surfaces for many days in some cases [1]. 

We have previously identified specific surface modification strategies which have been proven to dramatically reduce the lifetime of active viruses on surfaces. These include the use of metal ion impregnated surfaces, metal nanoparticles embedded in materials, and metal oxide nanoparticles embedded in surface textures[2].

[1] N. van Dorelman, T. Bushmaker, D. H. Morris, et. al. “Aerosol and Surface Stability of
  SARS-CoV-2as Compared with SARS-CoV-1”, New England Journal of Medicine, (2020).
  DOI: 10.1056/NEJMc2004973

[2] J. Hodek, V. Zajicova, I. L. Slamborova, et al. “Protective hybrid coating containing silver, copper and zinc cations effective against human immunodeficiency virus and other enveloped viruses”, BMC Microbiology, 16, 56, (2016). doi: 10.1186/s12866-016-0675-x

Risks and challenges

We believe there is great urgency in pursuing our work as it could in some small way help to "flatten the curve" in transmission of the COVID-19 virus. We are currently actively validating antiviral performance of this material. Its virus performance may not be fully validated by May but its antigerm performance is guaranteed. Additionally, the timing of our antiviral validations may be potentially impacted by work stoppage due to government's efforts in containing COVID-19. Given the uncertainty of the current pandemic, this risk is difficult to forecast.

story:
LumiLIFE is the world’s first, wireless-powered robotic fish and smart tank. The fish lives in a decorative, tranquil aquarium that brightens the look and feel of any room. The user has the ability to change the colors of the fish and tank, interact with their pet fish and receive notifications from the accompanying mobile app.




As Sphere Corporation, and the creator of LumiLIFE Aquarium, we were awarded a Guinness World Record for our representation of the first wireless-powered aquatic toy on July 15, 2014!




“Robotic fish shows incoming messages by flashing colorful lights…” –Engadget (translated from German)

“A high-tech aquarium holds robotic fish that feed off wireless power, glow, and swim about in a sealed tank.” –CNET

“Wireless electricity is here! And we’re using it to power…Robot Fish” –Digital Trends

“Avoid future fish tragedies by investing in this awesome new robotic fish contraption…these glow in the dark. Adorable!” –Gizmodiva

“…an amazing toy and decorative system…Most Advanced Robotic Aquatic Toy” –Ladies Gadgets

“The coolest part about the fish is that they connect to your smartphone…That is way more interactivity than your typical goldfish” –TechnaBob

“…I would very much like them on my desk. You too?” –Klongblog (translated from German)

“This is my style of fish!...What a soothing and decorative piece to have displayed in your living room or office” –A Year of Jubilee Reviews

“…a Designer Aquarium for Smart Fish…Clearly better than a real fish.” –Chip Chick

“…a designer aquarium with robotic fish to satiate your desire” –Home Harmonizing








With an engineering background, Simon has extensive project and executive management experience in worldwide CE/Toys R&D sector. He has a proven track record in managing the complete procedure in bringing concept products from R&D to production for market delivery.



Felix has over 15 years of experience in business administration and management, specializing in areas of compliance, logistics, accounting and finance. He is proficient in programming, electronics, production, sales, product quality and ensures customer satisfaction.



1. Do LumiLIFE robotic fish work in other aquariums?

No. Our robotic fish are uniquely built to receive power wirelessly from the LumiLIFE aquarium base only. Since it does not contain batteries, the only way the fish can receive power is from the LumiLIFE aquarium. The lighting, communication and control systems are built and programmed to function only within the LumiLIFE product.

2. What is the maximum number of LumiLIFE robotic fish that will work in the aquarium?

Although our current software and hardware are designed to allow for up to three fish,it is recommended to keep just one fish in the aquarium in order for the best display.We will be working on allotting for more fish to swim in the tank during next phase of our development.

3. Will there be other fish besides LumiLIFE’s Clownfish, Goldfish and Pufferfish variations?

Yes, definitely. Development of other variants of the robotic fish is very complicated and resource-intensive, but we will be working on creating other fish once the production of our current LumiLIFE product is finished. We have in mind the Anglerfish and Sea turtle, with the possibility of smaller fish in our next development phase. We would love to hear which fish you’d like to see!

4. I want to put more fish in the aquarium. Will there be a larger tank in the future?

We have made a prototype of a larger tank for testing and evaluation, but production takes considerable resources, time and requires separate regulatory approvals and certifications.

The LumiLIFE Aquarium we're presenting in this campaign will be best suited in almost all rooms and is the most popular according to a survey we conducted. For now, we are focused on producing this type of aquarium in order to give you the best possible experience.

5. I want to make my LumiLIFE Aquarium more special. Are there other base Deco Skin colors I can choose from other than the standard options?

Yes. We have more colors in development that will be made available for retail purchase in the future. We will likely include special editions of patterns and designs so that every LumiLIFE can truly be unique. Feel free to comment with the color you want, and we will make the ones that are most popular.

6. Does my LumiLIFE Aquarium come with a warranty?

The LumiLIFE Aquarium comes with a standard one-year limited warranty. The product should last several years, as it will be built with the highest quality of materials from, namely, Texas Instruments, Coilcraft, Dialog, TDK, Panasonic, and other major semiconductor manufacturers. Quality and customer satisfaction are of our utmost concern.

7. Will you ship to my residence?

Shipping to major markets, such as the Americas, Europe and Australia, will not be a problem as we are working to obtain regulatory approvals, compliance and certifications for the major markets.

Unfortunately, due to logistical and cost issues, we will not ship the product to countries designated as high-risk areas, war zones or pandemic outbreak areas as defined by NATO Shipping Center, WHO and common courier services such as UPS, FedEx and DHL. Please do not contribute if you reside in any of those areas.

8. When will I be able to purchase LumiLIFE in retail stores?

The LumiLIFE Aquarium will be made available at major U.S. retail chains and online stores once we have shipped the products to our Indiegogo contributors. The retail price will be substantially higher than what we are offering during this campaign, so now is your chance to enjoy our lowest factory price offer before the campaign ends!

story:
Overview

Savvka is a smart, small, & simple media player​ designed with both ease of use and versatility in mind. It offers great features at an affordable price:
✅ Stream content off multiple flash drives
✅ Compact design that fits in anywhere
✅ Dual network mode for online and offline usage
✅ Multiple users at the same time
✅ Supports USB 1.0/2.0/3.0/3.1 flash drives
✅ 4K Video streaming supported
✅ iOS/ Android/ Windows/ Mac/ etc. supported
✅ No app required
